acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.028mg/L of the fish (American Catfish) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 80mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-15 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 25mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-15 (2002)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category D by EPA (1993).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=1(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though the substance acts on mild steel in the presence of water, according to HSDB (2006). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2779 (Substituted nitrophenol pesticides, solid, toxic) (ICSC, 2004)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

explosives.rationale: Because of a lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy (though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -140). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2779 (Substituted nitrophenol pesticides, solid, toxic) (ICSC, 2004)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as flammable according to ICSC (2004). Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2779 (Substituted nitrophenol pesticides, solid, toxic) (ICSC, 2004)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo tests and no positive data on in vitro mutagenicity tests (several indices), described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-15 (2002).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: No data available, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2779 (Substituted nitrophenol pesticides, solid, toxic) (ICSC, 2004)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2779 (Substituted nitrophenol pesticides, solid, toxic) (ICSC, 2004)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of pup malformation at parentally toxic doses (or in the absence of data on parental toxicity) in teratogenicity studies in mice and rats, along with the evidence of reproduction impairment in rat reproductive toxicity studies, described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-15 (2002).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 38-42degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: No data available, though containing nitro groups with explosive properties. Classified into Division 6.1 (UN#2779 (Substituted nitrophenol pesticides, solid, toxic) (ICSC, 2004)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classified as Category 1 in accordance with the technical guideline, given the fact that the substance is classified as "corrosive" for "2. Skin corrosion / irritation" above.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of the human health effects (CERI Hazard Data 2001-15 (2002)): "Corrosive to the skin." Although classified into Category 1A-1C, the substance should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further subclassification is needed.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (liver, kidney, nervous system, testis, uterus),
Category 2 (blood system, visual organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (liver, kidney, nervous system, testis, uterus)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system, visual organs)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "the substance has toxic effects on the liver, kidneys and nervous system, and produces degenerative changes in the hepatic parenchyma and renal tubules" (CERI Hazard Data 20001-5 (2002)), "this substance has effects on the kidneys, liver, blood, immune system and eye, may cause cataract; may induce reproductive toxicity in humans" (ICSC (J) (1994)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies: "Histological changes in the testes including abnormal spermatozoa, spermatids and multinucleated spermatogenic cells," "tubular atrophy of testes" (HSDB (2003)), "cystic endometrial hyperplasia and testicular atrophy" (IRIS (1987)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2. The effects on the blood system and visual organ are classified into Category 2 since the priority rating of the referenced study (ICSC (J)) is 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (nervous system, kidney)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "directly affects, stimulates and suppresses the cerebrum and lower brain centers; causes necrotic damage to the renal tubules in the kidneys" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-15 (2002)). Also based on the evidence from animal studies including "somnolency, spasm" (RTECS (2006)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
